alert.note: Alert for Sampson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Training thunderstorms resulting in localized heavy rain across southeastern Sampson County through 600 PM EDT... At 457 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Richlands to near Harrells to near Williams. These storms were nearly stationary or training repeatedly across southern portions of the county. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Harrells, Garland and Ivanhoe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rain can be expected due to training storms. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
